instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> locked
threads.message:
hi,

i got that machine from customer and broken display.
now i replaced the whole display assembly, the display is working but it shows the lock symbol

is it because the display is from china ? i dont know if the symbol already was there before  i replaced the display. is that possible?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> locked
threads.message:
It's EFI locked. You will either need to put the original SSD in with the customers install, or get the EFI lock password from the customer.
If neither is an option, then pull the EEPROM / SPIROM and dunp the file a couple of times, make sure they both have the same MD5 and keep one as a backup. 0xFF out the small string of crap after each $SVSÂ° feild, flash it back to the chip and slap the chip back on. Done. Get a Mini Pro TL866 from eBay for about $40 i think

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> locked
threads.message: Keep in mind: If the unit was tied to a user's iCloud account with Find My Mac turned on, the board can re-lock itself soon after connecting to WiFi. Simply removing the password from the dump won't suffice if this is the case. Just a heads up and something to keep in mind.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> locked
threads.message: You ask the "customer" for the password.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> locked
threads.message:
thanks all.
the customer came in yesterday and after installing back the ssd everything was working like usually. so the problem was not the new display.
